title: Web Game Developer (Remote)
description:
['\n',

Are you passionate about building immersive browser-based games? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where creativity meets cutting-edge technology? We‚Äôre looking for a Web Game Developer to join our team and help bring engaging 3D gaming experiences to life.

,


, What You'll Do,
  • Develop and optimize 3D web-based games using Three.js and WebGL
  • Build interactive, high-performance gaming experiences with React and TypeScript
  • Implement game loops, physics, animations, and collision detection for smooth gameplay
  • Ensure optimal performance across different devices and browsers
  • Collaborate with designers and other developers to bring concepts to life
,


, Required Technical Skills,

‚úÖ Strong proficiency with Three.js for 3D rendering, scene management, and WebGL integration (lighting, materials, camera controls)

,

‚úÖ Advanced React development (hooks, custom components, state management with Redux/Context API)

,

‚úÖ Solid grasp of game development principles including physics, animation, and performance optimization

,

‚úÖ Expertise in JavaScript/TypeScript (ES6+)

,


, Nice-to-Have Skills,

‚ú® Experience with WebGL shaders & GLSL

,

‚ú® WebSocket implementation for real-time multiplayer features

,

‚ú® Canvas API for 2D game elements

,

‚ú® React Three Fiber (React renderer for Three.js)

,

‚ú® TweenJS or GSAP for animations

,

‚ú® Asset optimization and loading strategies

,

‚ú® Web Audio API for immersive sound design

,


, Compensation & Work Environment,

üí∞ Salary: Up to $100K (depending on experience)

,

üåç Remote: Work from anywhere!

,


,


, '\n']

title: Junior Software Engineer, Professional Services
description:
['\n',

Position Overview:

,

We are looking for an Early Career Software Engineer to join our Professional Services team. As a Software Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and delivering high-quality software solutions and integrations using C#, .NET, PostgreSQL, and AWS. In addition to your technical expertise, you will need to effectively communicate solutions to non-technical stakeholders, including clients. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and excellent communication skills.

,


,

Responsibilities

,

‚óè Collaborate with clients and internal teams to understand technical requirements and translate them into scalable software solutions.

,

‚óè Design and develop software integrations using C#, .NET, PostgreSQL, and AWS.

,

‚óè Communicate technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and understandable manner.

,

‚óè Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful delivery of software solutions within project timelines.

,

‚óè Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code while adhering to best practices.

,

‚óè Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, ensuring smooth operation of applications.

,


,

Qualifications

,

‚óè Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without current or future sponsorship. (W-2 employement only).

,

‚óè Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

,

‚óè Proven experience as a Software Engineer or similar role.

,

‚óè Proficiency in C#, .NET (8.0), PostgreSQL, and AWS.

,

‚óè Strong communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

,

‚óè Experience working in a professional services environment, interacting with clients, and understanding their business needs.

,

‚óè Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, client-facing role.

,

‚óè Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

,

‚óè Familiarity with agile development methodologies. Preferred Qualifications:

,

‚óè Experience working in a professional services environment, interacting with clients, and understanding their business needs.

,

‚óè Proven experience integrating with ERPs.

,

‚óè Proficiency in TypeScript.

,


,

If you are a skilled Software Engineer with a passion for delivering top-notch software solutions and the ability to effectively integrate external systems, we encourage you to apply and become a valuable part of our Professional Services team.

, '\n']

title: Remote Software Engineer (JavaScript) | WFH Opportunity
description:
['\n Join a premier online trust and safety platform that is committed to safeguarding businesses, consumers, and children from deceptive, fraudulent, and non-compliant mobile and Connected TV (CTV) applications, as well as websites. Our cutting-edge software and data solutions have garnered recognition for addressing critical challenges in digital advertising, privacy, and compliance. With a diverse and global team of professionals spanning various domains‚Äîincluding law, data science, engineering, and economics‚Äîwe are dedicated to fostering a secure online environment.',
,
, Job Overview

, 'We are seeking a highly motivated Software Engineer with a specialization in JavaScript to enhance our dynamic team. The successful candidate will possess a robust understanding of web technologies, browser behaviors, DOM manipulation, and video player integration. Experience within the ad tech industry is advantageous.',
,
, Key Responsibilities

,
  • Design, develop, and enhance our measurement scripts and front-end applications utilizing JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
  • Maintain and update our implementation of the Open Measurement Software Development Kit (OMSDK) for enhanced ad measurement and verification.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to test and integrate new features effectively.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve performance issues within browsers and video players.
  • Partner with the Quality Assurance team to deliver high-quality products.
  • Remain abreast of the latest advancements in web technologies and ad tech.

, Required Skills

,
  • Proficient in JavaScript, with a thorough understanding of its fundamental principles.
  • Familiarity with front-end frameworks and libraries such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of browser internals, DOM manipulation, and video player integration.
  • Experience with RESTful APIs and asynchronous programming techniques.
  • Knowledge of OMSDK and its application in ad tech solutions.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail.
  • Effective communication and teamwork capabilities.

, Qualifications

,
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Demonstrable experience with JavaScript and front-end development frameworks.
  • Exposure to industry practices related to ad tech is a plus.

, Career Growth Opportunities

, 'We offer abundant opportunities for professional advancement and personal development within a culture that promotes growth and success.',
,
, Company Culture And Values

, 'Our work environment fosters innovation and collaboration, motivating team members to challenge each other and reach their highest potential. We value diversity and inclusivity, reinforcing our mission to create a safe online space.',
,
, Compensation And Benefits

, 'Join us for a rewarding career with competitive compensation packages, including:',
,
,
  • Monthly reimbursement for internet expenses.
  • Flexible remote work options and hours.
  • Exciting annual team events.
  • A supportive atmosphere that prioritizes both success and enjoyment.

, 'Employment Type: Full-Time\n ']

title: E-Learning Curriculum Developer
description:
['\n',

Remote Learning Content Creator (This Position Requires 10 Hours Per Week)

,

(This Position Starts as an unpaid Internship)

,

Are you passionate about education and ready to inspire the next generation of learners? Flexi Solutions is on the lookout for innovative, creative, and tech-savvy individuals who are eager to create impactful educational content that reaches K-12 students or their parents around the globe.

,


,

About Us

,

At Flexi Solutions, we‚Äôre more than just an online education platform‚Äîwe‚Äôre a community dedicated to transforming how children learn, no matter where they are or what their circumstances might be. We‚Äôre driven by a mission to provide world-class educational opportunities to every child, bridging gaps in access to quality learning tools and resources. Our diverse team of educators, professionals, and industry leaders collaborate to build innovative educational experiences that empower children and support parents on their learning journey.

,


,

Your Role

,

As a Remote Learning Content Creator, you‚Äôll be at the heart of our mission to revolutionize education. You‚Äôll develop fun and innovative content, crafting lesson plans, activities, and interactive resources that make learning come alive for K-12 students or their parents. You‚Äôll work closely with our team to ensure that every piece of content is engaging, accessible, and effective for a wide range of learning needs.

,


,

What We‚Äôre Looking For

,

- Passion for Education: You‚Äôre deeply committed to making learning exciting and accessible for everyone.

,

- Creative Mindset: You can turn any subject into a captivating lesson that students and parents will love.

,

- Strong Writing Skills: You‚Äôre skilled at breaking down complex concepts and presenting them in a clear, engaging way.

,

- Tech-Savvy: You‚Äôre comfortable using digital tools to create and share content.

,

- Flexibility and Initiative: You‚Äôre proactive, adaptable, and ready to take on new challenges in a fast-paced environment.

,


,

Why Join Us?

,

- Flexibility: Work remotely!

,

- Impact: Help shape the future of education and make a real difference in the lives of K-12 students and their parents.

,

- Growth: Develop your skills and grow your career in a supportive, collaborative environment.

,


,

Compensation

,

This Position starts as an unpaid internship. There may be opportunities in the future for paid positions.

,


,

Ready to Make a Difference?

,

If you‚Äôre excited about the opportunity to inspire students and transform education, we want to hear from you! Send your resume to support@flexi-edu.com and let us know why you‚Äôre the perfect fit for our team.

,


,
  • Together, let‚Äôs build a brighter future for education!
,


, '\n']

title: Full-Stack Developer with AI/ML Experience
description:
['\n', Full-Stack Developer with AI/ML Experience | Exugo (Startup) | Equity & Growth Opportunity (multiple positions available),

üìç Location: Remote or Hybrid (East Coast Preferred)

,

üíº Type: Full-Time | Equity Options Available

,

üöÄ About Exugo:

,

Exugo is the hub for pioneers shaping the future of AI, automation, and transformative technology. Currently in stealth mode, we are building a next-gen platform for innovation and collaboration. Join us as we launch in 2025.

, üîπ What You‚Äôll Do,
  • Develop & Scale: Build and optimize Exugo‚Äôs AI-driven platform, integrating web-based UX/UI with AI-powered tools.
  • Architect & Design: Lead the development of a robust, scalable full-stack system that enables seamless automation and collaboration.
  • Integrate AI/ML: Implement machine learning algorithms, NLP models, and automation tools into Exugo‚Äôs platform.
  • Cloud & Security: Ensure smooth AWS/Azure deployment, backend efficiency, and high-level security.
  • Innovate & Own: You‚Äôll have a high-impact role in shaping the future of AI-driven collaboration.
,

‚úÖ Full-Stack Proficiency ‚Äì Expertise in React, Next.js, Node.js, Python, or Go for scalable web development.

,

‚úÖ AI/ML Experience ‚Äì Hands-on experience with LLMs, NLP, TensorFlow, PyTorch, OpenAI API, or similar frameworks.

,

‚úÖ Database & Cloud Knowledge ‚Äì Comfortable working with PostgreSQL, Firebase, MongoDB, AWS, or Google Cloud.

,

‚úÖ Product Builder Mindset ‚Äì Someone who thrives in fast-paced, early-stage startups and can think creatively.

,

‚úÖ Passion for AI & Innovation ‚Äì Excited about building tools that drive real impact in emerging industries.

,


, üîπ Why Join Us?,

üí° Equity & Leadership Opportunity ‚Äì Be a key player in a high-growth startup from the ground up.

,

üåé Work on Cutting-Edge AI ‚Äì Build something that pushes boundaries in AI, automation, and web innovation.

,

‚ö° Fast-Paced, High-Impact Role ‚Äì Your work will directly shape the Exugo platform.

,

üìç Remote/Hybrid Flexibility ‚Äì Work from anywhere, with options to collaborate in NY/NJ.

,


, üî• Additional Opportunities at Exugo,

üöÄ Contract and Part-Time Positions Available for:

,

‚úÖ Social Media & Community Manager ‚Äì Help build and engage our online presence across LinkedIn, Twitter, and emerging platforms.

,

‚úÖ AI Research Assistant ‚Äì Support the integration of AI/ML tools, research emerging technologies, and assist with data modeling.

,

‚úÖ UI/UX Designer ‚Äì Create sleek, user-friendly designs to enhance Exugo‚Äôs platform experience.

,

‚úÖ Technical Writer & Content Strategist ‚Äì Develop compelling articles, whitepapers, and product documentation.

,

‚úÖ Business Development & Partnerships ‚Äì Help drive collaborations and strategic alliances for Exugo‚Äôs growth.

,

üí° Interested in joining our team? Send your resume to: klaudet@energypn.com

, '\n']

title: Intern: Associate Software Developer
description:
['\n Is it surprising to hear that a financial institution of 1.5 million members and over $30 billion in managed assets say that success comes from focusing on people, not profits?',
,
, 'Our ‚Äúpeople helping people‚Äù philosophy has guided us since 1935, driving our deep commitment to serving our members, communities, and each other. When you join our team, you become part of a purpose-driven organization where your work makes a real difference.',
,
, 'While we‚Äôre proud of our history, we‚Äôre even more excited about our future. With business and technology transformation on the horizon, there‚Äôs never been a better time to be part of BECU.',
,
, PAY RANGE

, 'The Target Pay Range for this position is $18 - $25/hr hourly. At BECU, compensation decisions are determined using factors such as relevant job-related skills, experience, and education or training. Should an offer for employment be made, we will consider individual qualifications. In addition to your salary, compensation incentives are available for the hired applicant. Incentives are performance based and targets vary by role.',
,
, Benefits

, 'Employees and their eligible family members have access to a wide array of employee benefits, such as medical, dental, vision and life insurance coverage. Employees have access to disability and AD&D insurance. We also offer health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts, as well as health savings accounts, to eligible employees. Employees are able to enroll in our company‚Äôs 401k plan and employer-funded retirement plan. Newly hired employees accrue 6.16 hours of paid time off (PTO) on a per pay period basis based on hours worked (up to a maximum of 160 PTO hours per year) and receive ten paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Additional details regarding BECU Benefits can be found here.',
,
, IMPACT YOU‚ÄôLL MAKE

, 'As an ', Associate Software Developer -Intern, ' at BECU, you‚Äôll be a key contributor to creating enterprise-class software that supports our business objectives. You‚Äôll develop and enhance software solutions under the guidance of senior developers, gaining valuable hands-on experience in designing, coding, testing, and automating solutions. Your role will help streamline and improve business processes while providing you opportunities to grow your technical skills and contribute to meaningful projects.',
,
, To join our dynamic team, we require candidates to be residents of WA, OR, ID, AZ, TX, GA, or SC., ' If you‚Äôre located in Washington state and within a reasonable driving distance from Tukwila, we are requesting that you come into our HQ on Tuesdays & Wednesdays. For those candidates that live outside the commute distance of TFC and in any of our approved remote work locations, this role will be remote. Remote or onsite, we are committed to ensuring you are fully engaged and included in our collaborative environment.',
,
, What You‚Äôll Do

,
  • Collaborate with Your Team: Work closely with team members to determine the best technical solutions that meet software requirements, fostering a supportive and collaborative environment.
  • Design and Develop: Develop prototypes, proofs of concept, and software solutions by combining technical expertise with a growing understanding of software design concepts.
  • Build Quality Solutions: Write clean, scalable code for small features, automated tests, and scripts, following departmental procedures and programming standards.
  • Optimize Code: Identify areas of improvement in existing code and implement changes to enhance performance, maintainability, and reliability.
  • Streamline Processes: Automate and improve business processes with guidance from experienced team members and business experts.
  • Learn and Grow: Work under the mentorship of senior developers, gaining knowledge of coding best practices and advanced development techniques.
  • Support Deployment: Create continuous integration builds, deployment pipelines, and database migrations to support robust and reliable software deployments.
  • Document and Debug: Perform system analysis, write documentation, debug code, and contribute to delivering high-quality software.
  • Contribute to Success: Follow programming standards and participate in team efforts to meet deadlines and achieve business goals.
  • Perform Additional Duties: Support the team and organization by taking on additional responsibilities as assigned.

, What You‚Äôll Gain

,
  • Professional Growth: Develop technical expertise in coding, testing, automation, and deployment processes under the mentorship of senior developers.
  • Real-World Experience: Gain exposure to enterprise-class software development and contribute to impactful projects that drive business outcomes.
  • Team Collaboration: Work in a collaborative, supportive environment where your contributions are valued, and your growth is prioritized.
  • Technical Skills: Build your knowledge of .NET, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, and open-source technologies while gaining experience with Git, CI/CD tools, and Test-Driven Development.
  • Problem-Solving Skills: Enhance your ability to analyze and debug software, propose improvements, and contribute to optimizing business processes.

, QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum Qualifications:

,
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
  • Minimum of one year of experience designing software and writing production code in a team/classroom environment.
  • Experience delivering solutions in multiple programming languages and technical environments.
  • Proficiency in .NET, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, or Python.
  • Knowledge of Open Source (OSS) technologies.
  • Understanding of SOLID design principles, Object-Oriented Programming, and Design.
  • Experience using Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery tools.
  • Experience using Test-Driven Development concepts, methods, and tools.
  • Proficiency with Git for version control.
  • Understanding of data modeling concepts.

, JOIN THE JOURNEY

, 'At BECU, your journey as an Associate Software Developer- Intern, will be a foundation for building your career in software development. You‚Äôll work with experienced professionals, contribute to impactful projects, and develop technical skills that set you up for long-term success. Apply now and be part of a team where your growth, innovation, and contributions are valued. Together, we‚Äôll create exceptional solutions and make a meaningful impact.',
,
, '#BECU #YourGrowth #BECUJourney',
,
, EEO Statement

, 'BECU is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.\n ']

title: React Native Developer
description:

,
, 'Location: Rockville, MD',
,
, 'A React Native developer is responsible for designing and building cross-platform mobile applications using the React Native framework, creating user interfaces for both iOS and Android devices from a single codebase, while ensuring optimal performance and user experience across platforms, often collaborating with designers and backend teams to deliver a seamless product.',
,
, Job Responsibilities

, 'App development:?Architect, design, and develop high-quality React Native applications for iOS and Android, translating wireframes and prototypes into functional user interfaces. ?',

,

,

,

,

,

,
, Qualifications

,
, 'React Native knowledge: Familiarity with React Native core concepts, navigation, state management, and native components. ?',
,
, 'Cross-platform development understanding: Awareness of how to build apps that function seamlessly on both iOS and Android. ?',
,
, 'UI/UX design principles: Ability to create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces. ?',
,
, 'API integration: Experience with consuming REST APIs to fetch and manage data. ?',

Your contribution will shape the products we build and directly impact the direction of the companies we start.',

title: Intern: Associate Software Developer
description:
['\n Is it surprising to hear that a financial institution of 1.5 million members and over $30 billion in managed assets say that success comes from focusing on people, not profits?',
,
, 'Our ‚Äúpeople helping people‚Äù philosophy has guided us since 1935, driving our deep commitment to serving our members, communities, and each other. When you join our team, you become part of a purpose-driven organization where your work makes a real difference.',
,
, 'While we‚Äôre proud of our history, we‚Äôre even more excited about our future. With business and technology transformation on the horizon, there‚Äôs never been a better time to be part of BECU.',
,
, PAY RANGE

, 'The Target Pay Range for this position is $18 - $25/hr hourly. At BECU, compensation decisions are determined using factors such as relevant job-related skills, experience, and education or training. Should an offer for employment be made, we will consider individual qualifications. In addition to your salary, compensation incentives are available for the hired applicant. Incentives are performance based and targets vary by role.',
,
, Benefits

, 'Employees and their eligible family members have access to a wide array of employee benefits, such as medical, dental, vision and life insurance coverage. Employees have access to disability and AD&D insurance. We also offer health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts, as well as health savings accounts, to eligible employees. Employees are able to enroll in our company‚Äôs 401k plan and employer-funded retirement plan. Newly hired employees accrue 6.16 hours of paid time off (PTO) on a per pay period basis based on hours worked (up to a maximum of 160 PTO hours per year) and receive ten paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Additional details regarding BECU Benefits can be found here.',
,
, IMPACT YOU‚ÄôLL MAKE

, 'As an ', Associate Software Developer -Intern, ' at BECU, you‚Äôll be a key contributor to creating enterprise-class software that supports our business objectives. You‚Äôll develop and enhance software solutions under the guidance of senior developers, gaining valuable hands-on experience in designing, coding, testing, and automating solutions. Your role will help streamline and improve business processes while providing you opportunities to grow your technical skills and contribute to meaningful projects.',
,
, To join our dynamic team, we require candidates to be residents of WA, OR, ID, AZ, TX, GA, or SC., ' If you‚Äôre located in Washington state and within a reasonable driving distance from Tukwila, we are requesting that you come into our HQ on Tuesdays & Wednesdays. For those candidates that live outside the commute distance of TFC and in any of our approved remote work locations, this role will be remote. Remote or onsite, we are committed to ensuring you are fully engaged and included in our collaborative environment.',
,
, What You‚Äôll Do

,
  • Collaborate with Your Team: Work closely with team members to determine the best technical solutions that meet software requirements, fostering a supportive and collaborative environment.
  • Design and Develop: Develop prototypes, proofs of concept, and software solutions by combining technical expertise with a growing understanding of software design concepts.
  • Build Quality Solutions: Write clean, scalable code for small features, automated tests, and scripts, following departmental procedures and programming standards.
  • Optimize Code: Identify areas of improvement in existing code and implement changes to enhance performance, maintainability, and reliability.
  • Streamline Processes: Automate and improve business processes with guidance from experienced team members and business experts.
  • Learn and Grow: Work under the mentorship of senior developers, gaining knowledge of coding best practices and advanced development techniques.
  • Support Deployment: Create continuous integration builds, deployment pipelines, and database migrations to support robust and reliable software deployments.
  • Document and Debug: Perform system analysis, write documentation, debug code, and contribute to delivering high-quality software.
  • Contribute to Success: Follow programming standards and participate in team efforts to meet deadlines and achieve business goals.
  • Perform Additional Duties: Support the team and organization by taking on additional responsibilities as assigned.

, What You‚Äôll Gain

,
  • Professional Growth: Develop technical expertise in coding, testing, automation, and deployment processes under the mentorship of senior developers.
  • Real-World Experience: Gain exposure to enterprise-class software development and contribute to impactful projects that drive business outcomes.
  • Team Collaboration: Work in a collaborative, supportive environment where your contributions are valued, and your growth is prioritized.
  • Technical Skills: Build your knowledge of .NET, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, and open-source technologies while gaining experience with Git, CI/CD tools, and Test-Driven Development.
  • Problem-Solving Skills: Enhance your ability to analyze and debug software, propose improvements, and contribute to optimizing business processes.

, QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum Qualifications:

,
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
  • Minimum of one year of experience designing software and writing production code in a team/classroom environment.
  • Experience delivering solutions in multiple programming languages and technical environments.
  • Proficiency in .NET, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, or Python.
  • Knowledge of Open Source (OSS) technologies.
  • Understanding of SOLID design principles, Object-Oriented Programming, and Design.
  • Experience using Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery tools.
  • Experience using Test-Driven Development concepts, methods, and tools.
  • Proficiency with Git for version control.
  • Understanding of data modeling concepts.

, JOIN THE JOURNEY

, 'At BECU, your journey as an Associate Software Developer- Intern, will be a foundation for building your career in software development. You‚Äôll work with experienced professionals, contribute to impactful projects, and develop technical skills that set you up for long-term success. Apply now and be part of a team where your growth, innovation, and contributions are valued. Together, we‚Äôll create exceptional solutions and make a meaningful impact.',
,
, '#BECU #YourGrowth #BECUJourney',
,
, EEO Statement

, 'BECU is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.\n ']

title: AWS Cloud Developer(Secret/Top Secret Required)
description:
['\n',

¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Full Job Description¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†

,

¬†

,

Title¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†AWS Cloud Developer/Engineer

,

Work Location:¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†100% Remote

,

Duration:¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Long Term

,

Client:¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†DHS CISA

,


,

Overview: We are seeking an experienced AWS Cloud Engineer to lead the transition and implementation of multiple data intensive applications suite within AWS. This role is critical to the modernization of the cloud-based infrastructure and requires extensive knowledge in designing and deploying secure, scalable, and compliant AWS solutions. You will work alongside a skilled team of architects, developers, and operations professionals working on a high-visibility project with complex technical requirements.

,

Required Qualifications:

,
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience as an AWS Cloud Engineer or similar role, with a focus on infrastructure and operations in AWS.
  • Certifications: AWS Certified Solutions Architect (Associate) or higher.
  • Strong hands-on experience with core AWS services, including EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, and VPC, Fargate, EBS, ECR, EKS, Amazon Event Bridge Data Migration Services, DataSync,¬†Glue, Athena and identity and access management services.
  • Strong hands-on experience with AWS Cloud Development and Data Mining
  • Strong experience in API Base integration including RESTful and SOAP APIs.¬†
  • Strong experience in defining data integrations including batch data integration and cross-cloud data transfer.
  • Proficient in event driven architecture to include Amazon EventBridge and AWS Step functions.
  • Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code tools (CloudFormation, Terraform).
  • Familiarity with FISMA, NIST, or other security and compliance frameworks.
  • Expertise in configuring AWS monitoring and logging solutions.
  • Solid understanding of networking and VPN technologies as they relate to AWS.
,

Soft Skills:

,
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.
  • Excellent communication skills for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Collaborative mindset with the ability to work in cross-functional teams.
  • Ability to take lead and a proactive approach to problem resolution and risk management
,

Key Responsibilities:

,
  • Architecting and Deployment: Design, deploy, and maintain AWS infrastructure and services that align with industry security compliance standards, focusing on high availability, scalability, and fault tolerance.
  • Migration Strategy: Develop a seamless migration strategy to AWS, including assessing existing architecture, planning AWS equivalents, and implementing Infrastructure as Code (IaC) for consistency and scalability.
  • Multi-Cloud and External Service Integration: Design and implement secure, seamless integration between AWS and other cloud service providers (e.g., Azure, GCP) as well as external third-party services, ensuring interoperability and alignment with PTS OSS project requirements. Leverage AWS tools like Direct Connect, API Gateway, and Lambda for cross-cloud communication, data exchange, and secure access.
  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Develop and maintain IaC using AWS CloudFormation, Terraform, or other IaC tools to automate provisioning, configuration, and deployment of AWS resources.
  • Security and Compliance: Implement best practices for AWS security, including Identity and Access Management (IAM), Virtual Private Cloud (VPC), and AWS Config, ensuring adherence to zero-trust architecture and DHS-specific compliance.
  • Monitoring and Optimization: Configure AWS monitoring and alerting using CloudWatch, AWS Config, and other AWS tools. Optimize performance and costs through right-sizing, reserved instances, and resource tagging.
  • Networking: Manage and troubleshoot AWS networking solutions, including VPNs, VPCs, and Direct Connect. Collaborate to establish secure, reliable connectivity between AWS and on-premises environments.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with project stakeholders, architects, and operations teams to design solutions that meet both technical and business requirements, including interfacing with CIO team to ensure compliance with mandates.
  • Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: Develop comprehensive documentation for AWS architectures, security configurations, and compliance requirements. Participate in knowledge-sharing activities to ensure cross-team alignment on AWS best practices.
,


, '\n']

title: [Full Remote] Software Developer - Entry level
description:
['\n',

This position is with the IBM, it is one of the largest companies in the world and a leading brand in Information Technology. At Joinrs, we look for the best professional opportunities for junior profiles and display them on our platform.

,


,

The summary of the opportunity from Joinrs AI:

,

IBM, a leader in technology innovation, seeks an Entry Level Software Developer for a full-time position. Candidates should have basic knowledge in programming languages and operating systems. You will participate in software development, design, and support, contributing to Open Source communities. IBM offers a culture of flexibility, career growth, and learning opportunities.

,

--

,


,

At IBM, work is more than a job ‚Äì it‚Äôs a calling:

,

To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you‚Äôve never thought possible.

,

Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world‚Äôs most challenging problems? If so, let‚Äôs talk.

,


,


,

Your Role and Responsibilities

,


,

Position start dates are in 2025.

,

When working in this abstract, fast-paced, and continuously changing tech world, resilience, commitment, and curiosity serve as the foundation for success as an IBM Developer.

,

You will:

,
  • Participate in many aspects of the software development lifecycle, such as design, code implementation, testing, and support.
  • Work to create software that is of high quality and meets our clients‚Äô needs.
  • Have the opportunity to become a contributor within Open Source communities across multiple disciplines.
,

In your role, you will:

,
  • Be supported by mentors and coaches who will encourage you to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground-breaking impact for the wider business, our external clients, and their customers.
,

Our culture of flexibility and freedom are pillars that embrace long-term career growth and learning opportunities in an environment that highlights your unique skills and experience.

,


,


,

As an Entry Level Software Developer, you will:

,


,
  • Work in an agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code, and test innovative applications, and support those applications.
  • Assist with resolving network issues, configuring operating systems, and using remote desktop connections to provide immediate support.
  • Troubleshoot issues, collect data, elicit detailed requirements, then design and implement innovative solutions across multiple industries and sectors as well as governments and agencies.
,


,


,

Who You Are

,


,
  • Highly motivated and have a passion for creating and supporting great products.
  • Thrive on collaboration, working side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines, and you have very strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Great at solving problems, troubleshooting, and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.
  • Have a basic understanding of software development and programming languages.
  • Have the ability to learn new skills quickly and use the skills efficiently.
,


,


,

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

,


,
  • Basic knowledge in one or more of the following technology areas:
  • Java, Ruby, Python, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Node.js, Angular.js
  • Understanding of operating system software (e.g., MacOS, Linux, Windows).
,


,


,

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

,


,
  • Minimum 1 year experience working with operating system software (e.g., MacOS, Linux, Windows).
  • Minimum 1 year experience in development with JavaScript, Node.js, or similar.
  • One or more internships or co-op experience.
, '\n']

title: Junior Power BI Developer
description:
['\n',

The Marlin Alliance is seeking an enthusiastic Junior Power BI Developer to join our team supporting Navy clients. In this role, you will work closely with mid-level and senior developers to design and deliver data visualizations, dashboards, and reports, leveraging Microsoft Power BI and Dataverse. This is a fully remote position, but applicants must have the ability to obtain a DoD Secret Clearance.

,


,

Responsibilities:

,
  • Assist in developing Power BI dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to meet client requirements.
  • Collaborate with team members to connect, transform, and model data from Dataverse and other data sources.
  • Learn and apply best practices for Power BI development, including performance optimization and user-friendly design.
  • Support testing, debugging, and maintenance of Power BI solutions.
  • Participate in meetings with clients to gather requirements and present progress.
  • Document development processes and solutions to ensure knowledge sharing and maintainability.
,


,

Required Qualifications:

,
  • Active or ability to obtain a DoD Secret Clearance.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field, or 1+ year of relevant experience.
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft Power BI, including building reports and dashboards.
  • Familiarity with data models, relationships, and Dataverse.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
,


,

Preferred Skills:

,
  • Exposure to Power Platform tools like Power Apps or Power Automate.
  • Basic understanding of SQL for querying and manipulating data.
  • Relevant Microsoft certifications such as PL-900.
,


,

Salary Range:

,

$70,000‚Äì$95,000 annually

,


,

,

title: Remote Associate Developer eLearning | WFH
description:
['\n', Job Overview

, 'Join a leading provider of integrated information, education, training, and consulting services dedicated to enhancing success in healthcare regulation and compliance. Our mission focuses on driving efficiency, improving patient care, and aiding healthcare organizations in navigating complex challenges through innovative educational solutions. We are currently seeking a motivated and inventive Associate eLearning Developer to become a vital member of our dynamic eLearning Production team.',
,
, Key Responsibilities

, 'As an Associate eLearning Developer, you will be responsible for:',
,
,
  • Developing eLearning courses using tools such as Adobe Audition and Articulate Storyline to ensure a cohesive and engaging learning experience.
  • Collaborating with voice-over talent, content development teams, and external subject matter experts (SMEs) to deliver content in a timely manner that meets project objectives.
  • Conducting quality assurance to guarantee courses meet both technical and content requirements, swiftly addressing any issues that arise.
  • Troubleshooting minor technical or design challenges and communicating these effectively, along with solutions, to enhance processes.
  • Managing your time efficiently to balance multiple projects and adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Supporting the team with various tasks and initiatives to contribute to ongoing educational projects.

, Required Skills

, 'We are looking for candidates with the following skills:',
,
,
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially PowerPoint.
  • A strong desire to learn and excel in the digital media arena.
  • Familiarity with Articulate 360 and experience with audio editing software such as WavePad, Audacity, or Adobe Audition is an advantage.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication abilities.
  • Robust technical skills with a knack for independently troubleshooting and resolving technology or content-related issues.
  • Strong organizational and time management capabilities to effectively handle multiple tasks and shifting deadlines.

, Qualifications

,
  • A Bachelor's degree in a relevant field.
  • 0-1 year of experience in eLearning development, digital content creation, or a similar role.

, Career Growth Opportunities

, 'At our organization, you will have the opportunity for professional growth and development. We are committed to supporting your learning journey and career advancement by providing avenues to explore the digital media sphere and enhance your eLearning development skills.',
,
, Company Culture And Values

, 'Join a passionate team that values creativity and collaboration. You will be part of a culture that fosters innovation and encourages contributions that directly influence the effectiveness of educational initiatives in the healthcare sector.',
,
, 'If you are excited about the prospect of shaping the future of eLearning and education in healthcare, we invite you to apply!',
,
, 'Employment Type: Full-Time\n ']

title: Software Engineer
description:
['\n', Job Description,

This is a remote position.

,

We are seeking a talented¬†Software Engineer¬†to design, develop, and maintain scalable software solutions. The ideal candidate will have strong problem-solving skills, experience in software development, and a passion for building efficient and reliable applications.

,


, Key Responsibilities:,
  • Design, develop, test, and deploy high-quality software solutions.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement new features.
  • Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following best practices.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and enhance existing applications.
  • Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback.
  • Ensure software security, performance, and scalability.
  • Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies.
,


, Required Qualifications:,
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in¬†Python, Java, JavaScript, C++, or another programming language.
  • Experience with web frameworks such as¬†Django, React, Angular, or Spring Boot.
  • Familiarity with database systems like¬†PostgreSQL, MySQL, or MongoDB.
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) is a plus.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
,


, Preferred Qualifications:,
  • Experience with¬†DevOps tools¬†like Docker, Kubernetes, or CI/CD pipelines.
  • Knowledge of¬†microservices architecture and RESTful APIs.
  • Experience with¬†unit testing and test-driven development (TDD).
  • Understanding of¬†agile methodologies and software development lifecycle.
,


, '\n']

title: [Full Remote] Software Engineer
description:
['\n',

This position is in the team of Nike, a U.S. multinational company that manufactures footwear, apparel, and sports accessories. At Joinrs, we look for the best professional opportunities for Junior profiles and showcase them on our platform.

,


,

The summary of the opportunity from Joinrs AI:

,

NIKE, Inc. seeks a full-time Software Engineer with a Master's degree in a relevant field and experience in various technologies. The candidate will develop and test digital products, manage solutions, and provide on-call support. Telecommuting is available from most U.S. states. We offer accommodations for the interview process to ensure inclusivity.

,

--

,


,


,

Software Engineer - NIKE, Inc.

,


,
  • Beaverton, OR Develop, configure, and test programs, systems and solutions in order to meet defined digital product specifications and directions.
,


,
  • Perform technical development of digital products that meets the consumer needs as defined by product managers and aligns with architectural standards.
,


,
  • Assess a well defined problem and support the development of a technical solution that meets the needs of the business and aligns with architectural standards.
,


,
  • Manage small-to moderate-sized solutions, and play a key role in larger teams, working within parameters of two- to three sprints.
,


,
  • Advise product owners on discrete technology-related business problems, formulate solutions, including assessing their relative merits and risks.
,


,
  • Design and implement new features and fix defects in existing code base. Write automated unit tests to validate code changes and write automated integration, tests, and manually test changes in an integrated environment.
,


,
  • Debug issues found during testing and troubleshoot issues in production environment.
,


,
  • Provide on-call support for production incidents and resolve them in timely manner.
,


,
  • Telecommuting is available from anywhere in the U.S. except from AK, AL, AR, DE, HI, IA, ID, IN, KS, KY, LA, MT, ND, NE, NH, NM, NV, OH, OK, RI, SD, VT, WV, and WY.
,


,


,

Employer will accept a Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Information Systems and 2 years of experience in the job offered or a computer-related occupation. Experience must include:

,

,

‚Ä¢ Big data and data lake systems

,

‚Ä¢ AWS Cloud infrastructure

,

‚Ä¢ Linux sys admin

,

‚Ä¢ Docker containerization

,

‚Ä¢ Terraform automation

,

‚Ä¢ OKTA/IAM integration

,

‚Ä¢ Jenkins pipelines

,

‚Ä¢ Networking architectures

,

‚Ä¢ Kubernetes administration

,

‚Ä¢ Python coding

,

‚Ä¢ Monitoring tools New relic, Splunk, Signalfx

,

‚Ä¢ CM tools such as Puppet, chef, ansible

,


,

,

Apply at www.jobs.nike.com (Job #R-50041).

,


,

LI-DNI

,


,

We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees and job applicants. We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed.
